text: Delicious fast fresh huge subs for $6 and they accept credit cards and have 15 mins pick up zone in front. The staff was friendly and quick and place was very clean. I went w recommend sub Italian so good and the bread had the perfect bite an chewy soft texture.

I was craving a good sub that would remind of me NJ/NY and this place came highly recommended on Yelp. The meats and garnishes were great but the bread was the only thing that kept me from giving it 4 or 5 stars. The bread on the east coast has a better crust and better in general.
Great family run sub shop. Always fresh, made exactly how you order it and ready fast. Also, GREAT HOT GIARD. Lots of sub shops drop the ball on the Giard and that is a sin in the Chi.

Great, old-school, Italian sub-shop!!!  I cannot say enough good things about this place.  The cute and adorable decor,  the warm and friendly staff,  and the delicious subs make this place a West Town gem!  Every time I go into Vinnie's, I feel like I'm walking into a scene in Goodfellas.   If you're looking for a cheap, delicious, and convenient deli or sandwich option, than look no further.  Vinnie's is a must.

Man! I stuffed myself on the sausage deep dish and a meatball sub. I am from NYC orginally, but can appreciate good pizza, when I taste it. Def have to swing by when in town and get a taste of Chicago pizza.

Wonderful service and an amazing sandwich. I went with the special of the day which was turkey with fresh mozzarella and pesto mayo. So good! Also loved that they had the entire interior covered in kitschy Halloween decorations for the season. Will definitely be back!

Love Vinnies, wish they were open later and on Sunday's though...  Really friendly staff, speedy and accurate sandwich makers, they always get the orders right and have quality ingredients!  Favorites are the Italian and roasted turkey. You must get the oil and seasonings on anything you order.  Highly recommend!

Still the best! Vinnie's sandwich-making ninjas, brothers Omar and Luis, produce standard and customized 9" and 12" subs in the blink of an eye. Dawn and Darlene greet customers with genuine enthusiasm. Get ready: Halloween's 'round the corner and Vinnie's regulars can't wait to see Darlene's decorations!

Well, I thought at my age the last thing I'd have is shakiness about my faith & switch on over.   Sub sandwiches are what I'm talking about people, put down your pitchforks.    Anyway, I called over to Vinnie's since I saw the awesome reviews around 9:15 & asked if I could get a sub delivered.   'No' (cue tears).   I was told they had an order for around 150 subs and wouldn't be opening until 11 (cue The Cure level of angst & sadness).    But, she must have felt the pain over the phone, because she said if I came over right now, she'd make me one (cue Eye of the Tiger)!    So after talking to her (with so many 'honey's' & 'sweetie's' I felt like I was talking to my grandmother (who was awesome, shut up), I hopped in my car & ran everyone off the road to get there (maybe).    Damn. Get your ass to Vinnie's & get yourself an awesome sub & some love (grandmotherly you perv).

Great quality, great service!  Went here for a quick sandwich for lunch. Definitely worth it. They get super busy, but you see why. Also they are great with delivery. The delivery driver is a sweetheart, and pleasant.  Less expensive than Jimmy Johns and you get a bigger better sandwich. If you go in person expect a line, but reasonable wait.

I love the crunch of the bread!! The place is small. I went early and it was empty. Lunch is 1130 so it's best to go then.  I like their sandwich over Bari.  And the cost of a 9" Italian is only 5.00. Can't beat the price for the taste. I wish they added a little more meat. It's only 1 slice of each meat for the Italian.

Friendly atmosphere, fresh ingredients, super crispy sandwiches for a fair price. I work in the area and lunch in the West Loop isn't cheap, so I was pleasantly surprised to find this tasty place. A little bummed that soups aren't offered in the summer (understandable), but otherwise, great spot.

The sandwiches were good (i had the turkey tomato and mozzarella with pesto mayo), but the service? The service was great! I wish I could put whatever the lady at the counter does into a bottle and take it with me. She is a joy and I will def be back!

By far the best sub I ever tasted! I discovered this place thanks to some work colleagues of mine I thought their subs looked so good I just had to sneak a peak of where they got them. I'm so glad they left their subs in the fridge so I could find out where they got them from. After trying to figure out when I was going to get over there to taste a sub I finally got an opportunity to go during my lunch break today. I couldn't decide between the vinny and the Italian. I asked the lady at the counter and she recommended the vinny. So glad I went with her suggestion. The sun was so fresh and full of flavor. The sesame seed bun kind of scared me but it made the sandwich unique and added another layer of flavor. Will definitely recommend this place to my office for catered lunches.

Great subs with lots of meat, cheese, and veggies. Ordered a tuna sub and a procuitto sub today and both were outstanding. The prices are very good and you are able to get options that the big chains don't have. The service was fast and friendly and I will certainly return now that I live just a few blocks away. I highly recommend Vinnie's for a great sandwich.

Better than Bari. That is really all that is needed to know. They are both on the same street, but this place is just much much better. I really hope that whoever is reading it gets to experience how tasty these subs are. Try the smoked turkey. It's the bomb. The Italian is always good as well. Oh and the people that work there are very sweet. I'll be going to this place for the next twenty years.
This place is amazing! First time there today for lunch and was totally impressed. Super small place but I think that adds to the character of this neighborhood spot. Best tuna sub I've ever had.

Even if the food was bad here, I would keep coming back. The service here will NOT be beat. Whenever you walk in the door, the owner lady greets you with a great big smile and asks a genuine "how ya doin, hun?" Speaking of the food, the simple, fresh ingredients result in some of the best subs in the city. You owe it to yourself to come by and check it out!
What a great sub! My only complaint was that the bread was a bit stale, but I still inhaled the sandwich.

I think that this is the most legit sub place certainly in the hood and one of the best in Chicago.  It reminds me of the hero type subs I grew up with in NJ.  The nice Woman who works the counter is the sweetest person ever.  Only one suggestion - better chips to match a best-in-class sub.

Ashamed that it took me this long to check out Vinnie's; I wish they had a couple of hot options on the menu and I wish they were closer to my house.  Otherwise, good times. Tried the #1 and the Turkey Special; both were great, but the #1 is why I'll come back.  The hot giardiniera was the right call to add as well; very fresh ingredients and the bread was great. Fair prices given what I am ordering here, fast service, and depending on your timing, free parking very close by.

Very simple and good...the bread is very good along with the meat cheeses, etc, I always will compare to deli's out east or similar...which Vinnie's...its not as good (I wish it was as I'm a Chicagoan!).  Vinnie's does beat out Bari- a long time local sub joint.

10 times better than Bari or JP Graziano's. Those places only put one layer of salami on their subs.  Vinnie's has a perfect meat to bread ratio.  Their bread is much better than either of the places I mentioned above.  And their provolone actually has flavor!

At my job the owners buy lunch for everyone on birthdays. So someone suggested Vinnie's saying they had the BEST sandwiches. And OMG are the right. The freshest, crusty on the outside soft and chewy on the inside bread ever. My favorite is the turkey special but I sub the turkey for ham. You can't go wrong with anything that you order.  A very sweet woman called us yesterday since we order quite a bit, to inform us of their St. Patrick's day special. Just placed my order for their corned beef special.
Uncle Vinnie's Sub. With pickles.  That is all.
Great Italian subs at a reasonable price.  These subs are huge!  The people are super friendly!  I will be frequenting a lot.

Heading out on a road trip, I stopped to pick up an always delicious sandwich from Vinnie's. Though it is huge and at times a bit messy for the car, it is worth every satisfying bite. My partner and I typically order two and split them to enjoy two different flavours. We always get the special with chicken and pesto mayo along with a wild card decided on the fly. This time we got an Italian with hot jardinière. Success, as always.  Be prepared for this huge sandwich and enjoy as soon as you can. the oil can sometimes get to the bread making it a bit less crunchy and delicious.

I am not a serial reviewer but since I probably don't walk into Vinnie's without the encouragement from the other customers, I think it's only right into the same. I have been driving by Vinnie's for years and stopping by Bari's for all my sandwiches. I won't be driving by much any longer. From the moment you walk in, you get that unique neighborhood treatment that immediately created a bind between homely local joint and dedicated loyal customer.  Treatment that to be honest is not part if the Bari experience at all. The lady running the place could not have been nicer. It's "hon" this, hon that from when you walk in to when you leave. I felt like I was buying a sandwich from my favorite Aunt's sandwich shop. She explains the menu perfectly, in detail and in a way that really helps. They cater and deliver. I got the Vinnie's Special and it was humongous, loaded, fresh,delicious. Had the sandwich been have as good as it was, I still would have been going back because how well I was treated there but the truth is, the food matches the 5 start treatment. I cannot recommend Vinnie's enough and it's why I took the time to write this. This is the type of place we as customers need to frequent and support to help keep these special local neighborhood joints in business for as long as possible. Especially when this food service so thoroughly deserve it!

I would definitely consider Vinnie's a "best-kept secret" of the West Town and River West neighborhoods. The unassuming storefront is easy to walk past, but the subs are delicious, made to order and the staff are friendly and provide fast service. Highly recommended.

Best sub I've had in years ! Fresh bread , fast service and very friendly . The price was also very fair . I had the Italian and already want another one. Much friendlier than the joint down the street . See you soon !!

D'amatos bread, nicest people, great sandwiches! I wish they didn't discontinue carrying pepper jack cheese but that never made the sandwich so no loss of stars. I try to equally distribute my business between Bari and here because I like the giardinera better from Bari. The pesto mayo turkey sandwich is my favorite.

I wish I knew about Vinnie"s years ago.  I bring friends and co workers with me to get the look what I found bragging rights. I think if you give Vinnie"s a try you will become a regular. The lady that always smiles and makes you feel welcome behind the counter is the definition of good old school  customer service. I am so glad I found this gem.

Been a Bari regular for 10+ years. Never thought of trying a different sub in the area. Just had Vinnie's and I am impressed. Actually extremely impressed. And the place is FAST and organized (unlike Bari).

Had the vinnie's special #1 on their menu, i loved the sesame bun! It was my first time eating here and I originally wanted to try the half sandwich half soup option but unfortunately they did not have soup on their menu yet. I really loved the interior of this little sub shop, it feels very welcoming and has an old school vibe to it. They very carefully take your order to ensure you have everything you want on your sub. My sandwich was delicious! The deli meat and bread were fresh. The lady ensured me that next week soup should be available, can't wait to go back and check it out. Highly recommend this place for a tasty sandwich.

Always amazing.  Wish I still lived so close.  Leaving Chicago and had to stop in one last time a couple weeks back.  You will be missed but I couldn't leave town without leaving a 5 star review.  If you haven't been, do yourself a favor and go!  They deliver now too, so no excuses.

Fantastic food!  I come here really often and consistently get excellent service.  I love that they always double check your order in detailed writing to ensure that you get the best tasting sub possible!!!  Not only is the main lady a sweetheart but her daughter/sister/cousing (I'm not sure if they are related)  is also super nice! This is what hospitality is all about and they truly understand it! Thanks Vinnies! Rick

Great place, the ladies there are super nice and sweet. Love their subs, all the ones I had were excellent, and their Filbert's soda is off the chain as well. Their Vinny's special is great, all fresh and very tasty!

I usually go to Bari for my Italian sub fix but Vinnie's is just as good too! The Vinnie's Special is my go to sandwich there! I believe they pack a little bit more meat then other sub joints too.. Super nice service with the same local faces and great sandwiches you can beat that! Old school neighborhood feel that's refreshing in a world fading away with corporate America, fad food groupie places, and chains restaurants

I honestly don't know how the Jimmy Johns at Grand/Ogden stays open with Vinnie's down the street. The tuna-salad sandwich is the best I've ever had, and the turkey special with mozzarella and pesto mayo is equally awesome. Plus you can get a 9" sub for under $5, which is kind of insane considering the quality. Love this place!

Amazing! I have been on the hunt for a decent hoagie since moving back to Chicago from the MidAtlantic. Bari was once my go to place but they just haven't been satisfying me lately. I think I've found my new love with Vinnie. The turkey special, more than a mere vehicle for their delicious pesto mayo, is the best!

I never thought a sub could taste so good. The people here are super friendly too. Went here to grab lunch for work and the quality of all the toppings and meats were awesome. The bread is thick and cooked just right and they will smother it with whatever you want. The menu may be short but I'm sure it's all delicious. You'll have your sandwich fast too. By the time I finished paying I already had mine. Definitely coming back!

Best sandwich shop in town! You are always greeted with a smile and treated like family. The sandwiches are made with the freshest ingredients and are ready within minutes. I highly recommend this place.

Really friendly staff, clean place, reasonable prices...plus your sandwich will be ready in no time. I've had them three times this week...I had the Italian, and the last two times their special turkey with pesto mayo. Absolutely delicious!

Open til 6:00 PM Weekdays and 5:00 PM Weekends.  They also have delivery! The staff is very pleasant.  My subs are normally very good, but on my last order they used miracle whip instead of mayo by accident.  Generally though, they offer very good sandwiches in a neighborhood with much competition from places like Bari's and D'Amatos Bakery.
Love the sandwiches and "Hi Honey" from owner Darlene.  No wonder, then, that Vinnie's is one of my favorite go-to's!

I've been trying several times to get one of Vinnie's special Lenten Pepper & Egg sandwiches but every time I tried they were sold out. Last Friday I had to go out of town for the weekend so I just had to get one. Called as soon as they opened and placed my order. Now I am only sorry that they don't make them year round.  They were the best Pepper & Egg (I also had them add American Cheese to them) sandwiches I have had in years.  The eggs were done to perfection and the peppers were perfect without there being any greasy taste to them like I have had from some places. The taste was absolutely perfect with just the right amount of seasoning to them. Had me wishing for more for days. I know I am definitely going to be pre-ordering again thru the rest of Lent to make sure I get them again, because they have been so popular that they sell out fast. If you can you have to try one to see for yourself and I guarantee you won't be sorry.
I would come back simply for the warm inviting exceptional service! The beauty taking the orders and cash is the Best! My sandwich was fresh and delicious  from top to bottom! I will be back!!!

I'm no sandwich guru by any means. Normally if in west loop il hit up JP grazianos or other small family shops. Decided to try out Vinnies and I'm a fan. Lady behind counter is sweet Just as every one stated. Bread was soft. Giardinerra had a little heat but flavorful and the #1 was great even though I don't normally go for ham but thought id try their "specialty". Good sammich. Will be back

I love this place so much. I usually get the prosciutto mozzarella sandwich, but the others are awesome as well. What really keeps me coming back is the bread and customer service.  The bread is flaky on the outside and fluffy on the inside. I feel that the bread is the foundation of a good sandwich. When you bite into these sandwiches, you hear a loud, satisfying CRUNCH. Make sure you have that paper in front of you or on your lap because crumbs will go places.  And the customer service is the best. The owner (Darlene?) is the nicest person I've ever met. She's always there when I come in and she talks to me like she's known me for years. She makes you feel welcome the second you get there and makes sure you get your food quick and efficiently. She's the best. This place is the best...around.
So yummy and friendly service!! I also love the decor - very charming!! I got the Italian which was delish once I added some extra dressing. Yum!!

I drove 18 minutes one way to get the 12" Italian Sub with hot peppers. The bread is so flaky and crunchy and moist and delicious, the vinegar and oil is to die for, the meat is so fresh, I will definitely be back.

As I was walking down the street after my annual Christmas shopping extravaganza at the local goodwill. In an area full of cliche, try-hard, Italian places, I happened across a very unassuming sub shop. I thought I would pop in and quell the hunger baby growing inside of me.  The dining area is small, but it has the feeling of my grandmothers basement in a good way! The owners seem to take a lot of pride in the place, and it shows. Everything was very clean and the Christmas decorations were a testament to their Italian roots. The most important part of a sandwich is the bread, and they hit the nail on the head in that respect. Super cheap, great food, cool atmosphere, what else could you ask for. 5 stars.

Went to Vinnies today for the first time - outstanding.  The service was great and the sandwich was fabulous - fresh bread, good meats, etc. The place is clean and friendly. Vinnies is now high on my list of great Chicago joints!

Vinnie's is amazing! Their sub's are the best I've had in Chicago. I always get the daily special (turkey, pesto, mozzarella) or their tuna sub, you can make your own as well. The owner is also the biggest sweetheart! Vinnie's is so good that one of my friends ate their almost every day of the week for months. I unfortunately moved out of state and now always make it a priority to eat here when I'm in town.
In LOVE with this place!!...discovered on Yelp!...delicious,  family owned, friendly, quaint ....and did I mention DELICIOUS!!!....The tuna can NOT be beat!!....my new favorite spot for a sammie!

This is the best sandwich shop in the city, by far! Great tasting sandwhiches, of which I always get the VINNIES SPECIAL. So good! Quality of bread & meat is great & tasty. The customer service (owners) is the best. It's a small private owned business I feel good about supporting. They really take pride in their food and treat each customer special.  I often times call ahead to place my order, then park in the flashing zone and run in. Never an issue. Always ready...in & out. I admit, I always take a few bites before pulling off. ;) I've also ordered sandwiches for parties & have them cut into 3 inch sections for serving. Always a hit! I've gotten sandwhiches here about 20 times, always a pleasant experience and always consistent. One of my favorite Chicago locally owned establishments!

I used to come here more often when I worked in the neighborhood, now it's my go to spot for lunch when I'm in the area.  The tuna is great and the daily special (usually turkey w/ pesto mayo) is delicious! Friendly staff and decent prices! You will not be disappointed.
I'm born and raised IN Chicago (city of)...50 years Vinnie's #1 for subs. I've been to ALL the sub shops. Vinnie's runs it and SO clean!!!

Really enjoy this place on my days off for lunch. The subs are made fresh and packed. Usually I get the #1 Vinnies Special, but today I branch out to the Italian Veggie. Don't forget to take a peek at the beverage cooler. They carry all sorts of delicious craft sodas and beverages plus the fountain variety.

Super friendly service. Limited selections with a couple of Italian themed sandwich options. Got the ham and cheese sub which was simple and delicious! Firm crusty bread, soft on the inside and a bit stretchy - PERFECT. Very fresh toppings unlike the limp and slimy toppings from a national over publicized franchise we all know.

I live around the area & there's a lot of submarine competition around here. I've been to Vinnie's quite a few times for subs & they're delicious! The ingredients are fresh, great prices, & they're very sweet inside! Definitely recommend :)
One of the best italian subs #2 with hot peppers and the rumor is true the woman behind the counter could be the one of the sweetest people ever.

Live in the neighborhood and have always been die-hard Bari.  Today- my world was changed when I finally opted to go in to Vinnys.  The D'amatos bread (which I've heard Bari doesn't even use anymore) was excellent.  The owner was beyond friendly in helping pick a sandwich.  Quick service. Easy on the wallet.  Everything about it was on-point, I'd be surprised if I visit Bari for a sandwich again with this being an option.

I live down the street. Always opted for Damatos or Baris. I decided to try this place out today. I had the Vinnie's special with onions and hot peppers. As everyone has said, the woman at the counter was incredibly nice. The sandwich was great. The best thing was the bread. It was much softer than Damatos or Baris, which can be hard sometimes if you go later in the day. I'll be back.

I tried to place an order over the phone. The lady taking orders was extremely unprofessional and rude. Mid conversation, I decided that I would not order from this place because she was so inappropriate. I will never consider ordering here again.

I agree with everyone about how nice the owner is.  She was as helpful and sweet as could be. I had an Italian sub with hot peppers which was excellent and even a little spicier than I expected.  Will go back.

Quite honestly, if I had to choose amongst several shops in/near downtown, I would sooner head a block East to Bari. My all-time favorite Italian sub shop is Fontano's.  At Vinnie's, the service was fast enough and the guy behind the counter was certainly friendly, but I was not impressed with the quality of the sandwich so I went once and that was it.

Honestly the only way this place could improve in my opinion is the bread. I wish it was a little softer and warmer and I wish they had a meatball sub on the menu. Besides that this place is perfect. It's family owned and they are the nicest people in the world. The atmosphere is exactly what you want when eating a sub served to you with a huge genuine smile. It's calm, casual, and intriguing. I will definitely be back here the next time I'm in the area.

Besides my own mother I don't think there's a woman that I adore more than Darlene the owner. She's sweet enough to give you a customer service cavity and extremely hands on at Vinnie's working the register and chatting with customers almost every day. You can really taste the love that goes into the sandwiches here. They've got fresh Damatos bread slightly underbaked for the better, perfectly cured meats, spicy Giardiniera, and fresh fixens that put the finishing one of the most simple savory sandwiches.  Try the Italian with a side of potato salad, talk to Darlene, and I defy you to not be in love with this place.

It doesn't happen often, but there are times when I just don't feel like cooking dinner. It happens even less often that I want a sub for dinner. Last Saturday, both of these rare phenomena did indeed occur, and this is where Vinnie's delivered. Well, not delivered as in "brought to my house," but delivered as in "filled the void" and "hit a home run." After it was deemed that I wasn't cooking, I decided to pick up some viddles for dinner, make some tasty cocktails, and have an impromptu picnic across the street from my house. I headed to Vinnie's after I remembered reading such glowing reviews.  This unassuming little sandwich shop on Grand Avenue is fantastic. There's a huge variety of subs, available in two sizes: a nine inch or a twelve inch. Unless you're ravenous, a nine inch should suffice. There's plenty of options--all kinds of meats and cheeses, and lots of choices for vegetarians as well. In order to try as many as possible, I asked for a tuna salad, smoked turkey/provolone, and a 'capri,' which had fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil. Sandwiches are made fresh to order (obviously) and can be customized with the de-rigeur toppings of lettuce, tomatoes, oil and vinegar, onion, pickles, mustard/mayo, and seasonings. And for a small upcharge, they have premium add-ons like artichoke hearts, eggplant, or pesto mayo. And because my fiancé feels that no picnic is complete without potato salad, I grabbed a side of that as well. I was on my way in no time. Three nine-inch subs and the potato salad came in at around $17. Wow, that may be the least amount I've ever spent on food for a picnic. The highest price here for a sandwich is only $6.75, and that's for a twelve incher. You can't even buy the ingredients at the grocery store to make one for less money. This is cheap eats heaven! But of course, cheap means nothing if the food's not good, and this food was GREAT. Super-fresh ingredients, perfectly crusty bread, and just the right amount of well-balanced fillings. I also liked that they didn't use a heavy hand with the condiments. These sandwiches were damn near ideal. The potato salad on the other hand, was forgettable. I'd bet a million dollars it came from a five-gallon drum; completely mediocre and not worth the calories. Skip it, and go straight for their delicious sandwiches. Henceforth, Vinnie's shall be the standard bearer of subs.

Vinnie's is a great sandwich place in an area with a lot of good Italian sandwiches places. I go there for lunch quite a bit and it's always quick and tasty. Fresh bread and ingredients, great gardinera, and lot's of choices. Even though I always go with the large Italian. For a good sandwich in a pinch, Vinnie's is the place.

Best sandwich in Chicago. Period.   I used to be a loyal Bari sandwich customer for years....  That was until I saw the LIGHT.  This place can not be touched.  The owners are a wonderful couple and first time walking into this place you will feel like you've been there 10 times before.  The bread is outstanding and the deli meat is piled on.   I will be a customer for life.

You don't go there to eat in.  You go there to grab a quick sandwich that isn't the crap they serve you at Subway.  This place rocks.  I dream about their Ham and Cheese sub.  Super fast service....like so fast you better know what you want when you get to the counter or you will hold them up!  Grab a bag of chips, a pop and you are good to go!

My favorite place for a sandwich in Chicago. The service is great! Who can beat the friendliness of Darleene? The food is great too! Who can beat the craftsmanship of Omar?  My kids absolutely love it. We always feel welcome at Vinnie's.    It's not a big place, but there is always a few chairs available if you need to park it to eat your sandwich. And the place is decorated in extravagant manners according to the season. You should see the display they've got for Halloween!  I highly recommend it! The best sandwich place in Chicago!

The subs are top notch! Like the old Jays potato chips ad use to say..."can stop eating 'em!" The service was excellent and the lady at the counter, Darlene, is the nicest person you can ever meet.  My favorite is the Capri sandwhich.

I Know its a little controversial, but I prefer Vinnie's to Bari. This place has THE BEST Capri ever! When you dine-in its really relaxing, perfect for a quick lunch break. The Owner of Vinnie's Dar is seriously the sweetest lady, and all of the other employees are also super sweet. I pretty sure the girl who works when shes not there (which is almost never) is her daughter, because they look just alike. Anyways, eat here its amazing!!
Now this is what a sub should look like and taste like. Vinnie's definitely isn't lacking in the quality department. Every time I'm in the area, Vinnie's is a must.
Great subs made very quickly.  I'd even add another star for the ambiance and Chicago accents from the lovely ladies behind the counter.

One of the best sub shops in the city. It's cheap, the food is good, the subs are HUGE, and the service is incredible. Every time I walk in, I feel like I'm part of the family. The nicest people work there, I love it. A++ keep up the good work!

Well, I'm a bit disappointed here.  I don't like writing negative reviews, but the food service and food prep in this town has really dropped in the last five years.  I'm not a twenty-something easily impressed by flash and pizzaz, I expect quality products and proper proportions.   The Italian subs that we ordered were quite lean on the meat side (and we paid for extra capicolla!).  The sandwich had the amount of meat that I consider a "ordinary" sandwich.  The mortadella was the overwhelming flavor, and I'm not a fan of bologna- so I had to go home and add a little peperoni to it to really round out the flavor of the sandwich.  The hot giardiniera was noticeably large and crisp (nice), but there was hardly any lettuce on the thing.   Of the three sandwiches we ordered, one had twice the giardiniera of the other two, and one hardly had any lettuce at all.  Too much inconsistency for supposedly identical sandwiches.  On the good side, the price is not way out of line.  I just was expecting more meat for the additional charge.  The bread was fresh and had a slight crust which was nice.  The quality of the meats were great, just not enough of them.     For the price, don't expect too much... an "OK" sandwich at best.   However, I will not be back.

Vinnys wins over Baris for this gal!!! I love the Vinnie's Special on Sesame with the hot peppers. They have a great selection of chips and soda.  I love, love, love the sweet lady who calls me hun every time we go there, which is almost weekly.  Great service and atmosphere.  This is a great spot and they also deliver.

I remember when Vinnies first open with a kicking menu.  Eight and half years later,  They have out done themselves.   Very few places in Chicago where you get a good meal and peaceful atmosphere.  I really did enjoy sitting outside with a fresh sandwiches and knowing the price was worth the experience.   I use to go to Bari but not any more.  When I come to town, Vinnies Sub Shop is where I would lay my hat for some Good 'Ole Chicago Sandwich.

The battle between Bari & Vinnie's is constant in our household, but in my opinion, Vinnie's wins out for subs.  Though we definitely frequent both neighborhood Italian spots.  Everything is deliciously fresh!  Try the mozzarella and prosciutto!

I got the chance to try Vinnie's Sub Shop since my new work is located near it. I absolutely love this place after going only once. They have every chip flavor under the sun as well as a bunch of soda varieties. I had the ham and cheese and it was delicious. Going back today to try this tuna that everyone is raving about.

I just moved right in the area, from New York. I love sandwiches, subs, hoagies, grinders, WHATEVER you want to call them. Asking around, everyone said Vinnie's and Bari are both fantastic. I still haven't tried Bari, so I can't comment on that. But this is about Vinnie's anyway, right? Right. I went to Vinnie's yesterday for lunch. The food was fantastic. I got a 9" italian sub, everything was fresh, and it was plenty big enough where I wasn't hungry at all until after dinnertime. What really stands out is the service here. The woman who served us was SO genuinely friendly and helpful. Like others have said, the service makes you feel like you're a regular even if it's your first time there. There's also some outside seating, which is always a plus. I've only been once so I can't speak for everything on the menu, but between the service and what I DID have, I highly recommend Vinnie's.

The woman (now fiancee) and I made the trek to Vinnie's a while back to see how it stacks up against Bari. I ordered an Italian sub and she got the vegetarian so we could do an apples to apples comparison. While the sandwiches were very good and I do not have any major complaints, they are not in the same league. Would I put my "D" in it? Perhaps, but not with the same amount of passion I would with a Bari sub... Overall, there is good value here, but with Bari so close, I would say to go there. Although our cat did quite enjoy the meats on the Italian...she is now on a diet.

I've had sandwiches at many spots in Chicago--Vinnie's is one of the best if not the best.  The ingredients are top notch and super fresh, the prices are beyond reasonable, the service is quick and friendly. Vinnies is one of my favorite post-call spots for quick, tasty food!  You just cant go wrong Get the Vinnie's Special, hold the oil, and add mild peppers---can't beat it

Who are the crackheads reviewing this place?  I live near here and it is on my walk to Bari, so I have stopped in 3-4 times since it is a closer walk.  I'm done going here. The sandwiches are ok at best.  Compared to Bari they are NOT EVEN CLOSE in quality.  The bread is actually not good at all.  The sandwiches are a tiny bit more expensive than Bari and you get a smaller sandwich for less. I've always walked here but there is zero parking nearby, so good luck with that. The main problem with their nearby competoitor Bari (down the street) is that during lunch time the wait there is bad.  It is undoubtedly a long wait... but it's worth it.  I would much rather walk into Bari and wait 15 minutes, knowing I'm getting a life changing sandwich, than ever eat in Vinnie's again. Skip this place and go to Bari, a Chicago classic, next time.

If Walter Matthau and Jack Lemmon had went here about 15-20 years ago,  "Grumpy Old Men" would have never been filmed... Because after experiencing the friendly, almost family-like, service from Vinnie's Sub Shop; it's impossible to leave without a positive and optimistic outlook on your day, week, hell maybe even the rest of your life.   Parking is funny, there's almost 8 signs in front of the general store front area that state it's a tow zone. I was first to park there today. 15 min later (after I ate), there were 6-7 other cars parked in this zone...whatever right? I've been on a quest for the best Italian sandwich, so that's what I went with. The bread is so good that even pro-choice and pro-life advocates could agree on it. The selection of meat and cheeses are what I've grown to love about this classic sandwich. Pungent Provolone cheese and my favorite varietals of Italian cold cuts.  I should have been more adventurous with my veggie toppings, but I thought it best to stick with their version for my first time. Which consists of traditional lettuce, tomato, onion, and girdinara (if requested). But they didn't give me that eye opening enjoyment I usually get from these sammy's.  They had things like eggplant (roasted or spreadable?), olives, roasted red peppers, artichokes, pesto mayo, and sun dried tomato. Defiantly recommend loading your sandwich up with all of this instead of what they do, maybe skip olives for some girdinara. DAMN! NOW I WANNA GO BACK! Great chip selection, daily specials, good looking soup (from eyeballing a friends), all backed up with quick, efficent, and motherly service make Vinnies a definite sandwich lover must.
Excellent service.  Excellent subs.  Excellent and fun choices for non-alcoholic drinks.  Will return next time I find myself in the west loop.

Tried Vinnie's for the first time today. It was DELICIOUS! Got a half sub (turkey) and soup (chicken noodle), it was all really good. Price was very reasonable and staff was super friendly. Place is small inside, with only a few spots to eat. Will be going back!

Our favorite sub shop in Chicago!! The turkey special (turkey, tomato, fresh mozzarella, basil, and pesto mayo) is amazing!! I don't think my husband or I have ever had something that we didn't like at Vinnie's.The service is outstanding. You definitely won't be disappointed.
Great service and excellent subs. Way better than the rest of the sub shops I have gone to. I go every chance I get when I'm in town.

This one's for Epstein. I'm sooo confuuused. That was how I felt until... Wooaht?  Vinnie's. Way-uh?  On Grand Avenue. When?  Whenever you want a tasty, reasonably priced sub on fresh Italian bread.   It's just that simple.  It's basically on the level of Ba-Ba-Ba, Ba-Ba-Ba-Bari but with better, quicker, friendlier service. The only problem is that the parking situation on this stretch of Grand will leave you sooo confuuused.  Up Rahm and the City's nose... Five stars.
Better than Bari?   I would say yes.  This is my neighborhood spot for subs.  Great service and great people running this place.

Wow. I still crave the sandwich I didn't have a chance to finish. It was the special of the day - turkey with homemade pesto mayo, fresh mozzarella, delicious bread - perfection. At $6.75 too, what a steal. I was pretty full after eating just half of it. You can't find a sandwich like it in Houston for that price. Maybe I haven't searched enough but I've considered going back to Chicago just for this sandwich!  I'm thankful for the barista at Sip who recommended this place. The owner is so sweet and friendly, she even offered to show us to the CTA station. What a great way to end a weekend in Chicago with David C. and friends! I can't wait to come back here next time I'm in town!

Great sandwich. Great value. Absurdly ridiculously good service. How many adjectives and adverbs can I use in three fragments. We stopped by here impromptu before I dropped the ol' lady off at the subway station. We got the rec from the barista at Sip who seemed to know what was up.  I got the Italian sandwich and it was way better than my former gold standard: the Jimmy John's #5. The bread...to die for... She got the special of the day, a turkey pesto salad with fresh mozz. and homemade pesto. I only had a corner of her sandwich and it was way better than mine. Also the sandwiches were super big - 9 inches for the small? Just incredible.  I can go on and on about how cool and friendly and "Italian" the owner was but bottom line - grab a sandwich here - you won't regret it.

From the second you walk in you are made to feel like you've been a long time customer. I had never stepped in before today, and the owner made me feel very welcome and had a big smile on her face. I guess its maybe that this kind of service isn't as much the norm anymore that one notices it when it's right there in front of you.  Anyway, I felt like making it classic and got a 9" roast beef and cheddar sub. I also added in some roasted red peppers to it mostly because roasted red peppers are awesome. It probably took barely around 5-6 minutes for me to get my sub after placing the order. It came faster than I even expected.  The sandwich itself was spot on and really good. I know its not hard to do a good roast beef+cheddar, but this was really damn good from first bite. The oil and herbs that they used along with it just hit me right.  It's not often I'm in the area, but if I do find myself around here I will certainly be stopping in again

Vinnie's is the closest match to a NYC sub place that has great service. Whenever I visit the owner always greets everyone so nicely and treats them as family. Amazing subs period and it should be considered as one of top sub shops in the city (for me it is better than Bari). The turkey sub is my all time favorite but all of them are pretty delicious.

I love this place! I live close by and I always have a taste for Vinnies. My favorite sandwhich is the turkey pesto mayo.. yummmmmm! You can pretty much alter the sandwhich every which way depending on what you like. The owner, Dar, always greets me with a "hi sweetie!" which makes me feel so appreciated. Over the years this place has gotten pretty busy, which I am very happy about cause I know its not going anywhere! Its a great place to eat and they even have a nice patio out front. Speedy service, sweet people, and tasty subs- what could be better! One more thing that keeps me coming back is to see what Dar has decorated her window like. Every holiday and every season she changes her window :)

I am a regular at Bari.  So much so that I felt a little guilty going to Vinnie's right down the street.   I got the italian just to compare it to Bari's signature offering.  After doing a highly scientific taste test (transation: eating sandwich for lunch) I have come to the conclusion that I prefer Bari.  However, that is not to say that Vinnie does not make a totally delicious sandwich. Both use bread from the local bakery D'Amatos (right down the street on Grand).  For some reason though, Bari's bread seems to have a crispier crust, which is the way I actually prefer it.  Both seemed to put the same ingredients in the sandwich.  However, Bari's sandwich has more bite, in terms of flavor and spiciness.  The hot from Vinnie's barely registered.  I wasn't sure I actually had any giardiniera until I checked.  I ended up adding some of Bari's super-hot giardiniera to my sandwich.   Prices are pretty much the same ($5 for a 9" italian sub). One thing Vinnie's has over Bari is customer service.  It's not that Bari isn't friendly, it's just that Vinnie's is super friendly.   Yes, Vinnie's is friendlier, but in my mind, Bari still makes a superior sandwich.

I've been to Vinnie's a few times so thought I'd take the time to give this shop its props. They have the absolute best sandwiches around!  The bread and all of the ingredients are so fresh and delicious. Their provolone cheese is fabulous! My favorite is the Italian, but all of the sandwiches are really great. Also, the people that run the place are super friendly and always make you feel so welcome. I love, love, love this place! Try it - you won't be disappointed.

The sandwiches here are great and a very good value.  Since there's a lot of places to get a sandwich in this neighborhood, that's very important.  The bread is delicious - crunchy and crusty on the outside and soft and airy on the inside.  They also sometimes have this awesome cheddar cheese and bacon soup.  I've only had it once, when the owner, Dar, brought some over to my former place of business, but I anxiously await the day that I walk in and they have it again.  I'm sure they have it on a semi-regular basis, I'm just never so lucky to go in on the right day. However, the bottom line is that even if the sandwiches sucked here (which they don't at all), I would still patronize Vinnie's because of the owner.  Dar is one of the most pleasant women I've ever interacted with - one of those old school, neighborhood broads that calls everyone "honey" and recognizes you on the street when she sees you.  Seeing Dar every day was one of the things that made me look forward to going to work every morning, and I'm just glad I still live in the neighborhood so I can see her from time to time.

My wife and I usually go for a sandwich on Saturday for lunch.  We've done the Potbelly, the Jimmy John's and sometimes the Subway (out of convenience).  Today we finally decided to go local.  So we checked on Yelp, saw the reviews and found Vinnie's. We ordered a 12 inch Italian to split.  After the first bite, I have no idea what the hell we've been doing giving our money to those awful franchises.  The meats were fantastic, and nicely complemented their home made bread.   Also, the lady behind the counter is probably one of the nicest people I've encountered in a retail environment - EVER.  We are making this our go-to sandwich shop.

Pretty decent subs. The french bread is light and airy rather than dense and hearty, which I was fine with but my dining companion found unsatisfactory. We split the 12" vinnie's special which was obviously plenty for two people. I really like krakus ham and between that and the bread, it really brought back memories of childhood. I thought their oil and hot peppers were excellent, and the lettuce and tomato were quite good. But I'm kind of suspicious of a place that offers miracle whip, and there were styrofoam plates, and overall it was good but not exceptional. I have to say the employees were ridiculously friendly.
Go to Bari instead, right next door. Terrible service.

This was a good sub.  I came here all the way from Lockport for a GREAT sub.  Yelpers, you let me down.  The place would have been much better if it was just around the corner.... Place is clean, 1 table outside with an umbrella which was occupied - and service was pretty darn good. If I'm in the neighborhood, I would grab a sandwich for sure.

The first time I walked into Vinnie's, I was treated as if I'd been coming there for years. The ambience is exactly what you'd look for in a tiny deli and the lady who runs the place makes you feel at-home and comfortable.  On top of the friendly atmosphere, the prices are even friendlier; $5.50 for a nine inch sub. Easily the freshest sandos in the west loop and worth a visit next time you're in the area.
Great place.  The lady behind the couter is the nicest ever.  They have a great tuna salad sub and I like the bread better than Bari.

The first time I tried to come here it was closed.  I think they are only open for lunch or something.  I finally got the opportunity to come during a lunch hour on a day that I was not working.  The subs here are simply awesome, they are fresh and filling.  I got the #1 Vinnie's Specialty Sub.  It was very delicious, moist bread.  Yum!  I love the size of the potato chip bags they sell here.  They have lots of varieties and options as well.  I wanted to try so many different sandwiches, but I guess I'll have to wait for another day that I'm at home.  The prices were decent, and the staff was very friendly and gave good recommendations.  They also deliver and cater.

Great sandwhiches, great service. The bread is always fresh, crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. I love their tuna salad and the turkey is my second choice. Every time I've been there the same lady greets us with the biggest smile and is just incredibly nice. I have yet to have a less than awesome experience at Vinnie's and doubt I ever will.

We just discovered Vinnie's delivers to our apartment... This changes everything. We usually hoof it down grand when it's nice out to eat these delicious subs but during the winter, not as frequently. You can't go wrong with anything you order here.  Their tuna salad is out of this world.

Not hungry but having a bad, then this place will cheer you up with the delightful and sweet woman who takes your order. It's like walking into sunshine! THEN of course order one of their very delish subs since you're there anyway!   They always have a special or go with your regular favorite.   I started coming here after I decided I no longer wanted the verbal abuse and attitude from the folks down the street, you know the one, it rhymes with "sorry". :)  The subs at Vinnie's are soft and fresh. Subs that rip the roof of your mouth because of their hardness just doesn't appeal to me or my mouth for that matter.  I will go out of my way to eat one of these bad boys  when I get that sub craving, to get anything else will not cut it.   This place has fast, good and like other reviews have said, extremely friendly service!   Customer service and good food are not dead!

If you haven't been here you need to go!  First off you're greeted by the nicest women who walks the planet and then you get the best sandwich around town.  The bread is perfect every time, the meat is fresh as it gets and there's just not enough I can say about it, I love Vinnie's!

I love this place so much! The owners are fabulous.  The sandwiches are great, everything is always fresh and delicious.  A few days ago, I tried to go in at the end of the day and I sadly learned that they were out of bread because they had been so busy that day... you know what, that made me appreciate them even MORE.  That's how yummy and fresh everything is.

Vinnies is good. I don't have anything against them but I just think Bari is better. I don't know if it's the bread or what. When I was eating the #1 I thought, eh, it's okay. But when I eat an Italian from Bari I think it's the best thing I've ever had.   Maybe I shouldn't compare the two. I like that Vinnies has outdoor seating. And yes the lady that owns it is a cutie. I don't feel like there's any attitude at Bari, just a long line, which moves efficiently. Thumbs up to Vinnies for sesame bread. I like!

Official old school Grand Ave subway shop. Shout out to Mario's Subs who use to be in my old neighborhood on Grand Ave just West of Ashland before it closed down in the late 80's. Grand Ave has a history of these subs shops with others still lining Grand to this day. I like this one the best since the bread is almost always fresh, great selection of fresh meats, cheeses, veggies, condiments and they don't make customer service like this anymore. Small little deli with a few seats inside and out front during the summer. Just go and find out for yourselves.

Finally got to try our neighborhood sub shop! (No offense, Jimmy Johns, but it always bothers me that you charge me the same price for a JUST salami sandwich as the italian with three types of meat on it, and wont let me get more than the 2 lame slices of salami that makes up the salami portion of the italian sandwich....but I digress....) Vinnie's is a family place and has a great authentic vibe! Love the decor and the neighborhood advertisements... definitely a neighborhood place! Makes me happy :) The tuna salad sandwich was delicious and the bread was fresh and yummy. Just perfect!  My husband loved his giant Italian sandwich as well. Great prices! Fantastic, friendly service! They were all out of spumoni, but I will definitely get it next time!!!! Love all the pretty sodas too.. I might have to try one next time. Glad to support local, family owned small businesses :)

On a recommendation, I got the Italian sandwich with giardenera on the side. Very happy with it! There was a long line out the door but they were very efficient and the woman taking orders was cheerful and friendly.

I think what makes this place great for me is the kind lady behind the counter. She's there most of the time. She'll call you 'Sweetie' and make you feel right at home. If she's not there, it might be one of her kids helping you. But Vinnie's is family run for sure.  In my experience, the sandwiches come out super quick. They're pretty darn delicious and pretty darn filling. The tuna is really good, and so are the turkeys, other meats, and veggies, though I have a hard time not ordering a standard Italian. V's has Filberts sodas and other bottled drinks, or fountain soda to drink. Also, some standard chip options, and soup in the winter.

Yo, Vinnie! After patio strike outs at Twisted Spoke (snarly hostess), Clutch (one waitress for the entire bar/patio) and Cafe Fresco (closed til 4pm)...we stumbled upon Vinnie's, a sweet little sub shop with 5 outside tables flooded with late Friday sunshine.  Fresh bread, happy people, GREAT food, hometown sodas and a few patio tables = 5 stars, FOR SURE.  The Italian sub bread is SO fresh/good...not hard/tough/chewy/rip your mouth apart, but firm enough not to get soggy. I noted multiple times how good it was...and just as I turned around the owner was coming back with an armful of more bread...straight from the bakery, asking how we liked everything. Amore! Capril 12" (tomato, mozzarella, basil, oregano) Vinnie's Special 12" (it looks like everything + kitchen sink) 3 Filbert's Sodas (Chicago made!): Peach, Black Cherry & Ginger Ale Approximately: $20 + tip.  The black cherry tastes like old school ring pops...I'd go with Orange next time.  Great place for pick-up, delivery or patio dining in the warmer months. I'm thinking they'd make great "catering" sandwiches for a party as well... Good stuff, Vinnie. Well done.

After reading all the reviews, I had to to try it.  I think it was the first trip learning curve, but I missed adding a few things like hot peppers.  I had the Italian Veggie sandwich.  I was kind of concerned, because I tend not to like the grilled veggies at most places, but the eggplant and zucchini here was fine.  Still not something I love, but at least it was OK. One thing I have to say... the bread here is awesome.  Also, the lady was really nice, like everyone else mentioned.  If not for the bread, though, I might have given Vinnie's 3 stars.  It's OK, I will give this place another chance and be more prepared next time I go.  Plus there's a Capri sub, which may be more of what I like.

I just got back from vinnie's and am feeling exceptionally satisfied. It's a beautiful day in chicago and i decided to have a nice sandwich. As i have family in town, it was all the more likely that we would venture out.  We were greeted by the owner before we even walked in.  She was a very lovely woman, who treated us like old friends. We talked about the neighborhood for a minute before she told us all about the day's specials. those seemed so good  that i was the only one who managed to order from the menu. I tried the vinnie special. and it was great. the homemade vinegar and oil dressings really made the sandwich for me. we continued to talk to the owner while we relaxed and planned our day. i plan to start going there for lunch during the week, as in a stressful office environment, it's nice to have a place where you know someone will be nice to you.

Rule #1:  NEVER let them see you sweat. I was adventurous yesterday, so I used my Yelp iPhone app to cross a bookmarked place off my list.  Italian Sub Sandwich at Vinnie's it was.... The place was busy.  People were lining up....and you can tell that the lady behind the counter was frazzled.  She was all over the place!  She was forgetting to ring up orders, missing items AND VOICING HER FRUSTRATION!  Kinda left a bad vibe for me as a 1st timer.  Nice recovery though when she rang me up.  She was really sweet & friendly. The sandwich was really tasty.  Awesome bread, a faint hint of pate flavor in one of the meats, fresh veggies.  DAMN GOOD.  Would I come out of my way for Vinnie's?  Probably not, but I will definitely hit up the place when I'm in the general area...like, tomorrow.

The lady at Vinnie's is the most friendly lady ever.  So sweet.  Worth going just for that.  I like the #2 Italian.  Ingredients are fresh.  I do not like their tuna salad, though.  Way too much onion.  It's overpowering.  Very much recommended if you're in the area.  Wish they were open a little later, but Grand is a dead zone at night, so I can't say I blame them.
super nice on the phone when i called. was delivered within 30 minutes of my call. might be a little on the pricey side, but fresh ingredients made it worthwhile. will order from again.

i have been working in the hood for over 4 years and tried vinny's for the first time yesterday.  I have really been missing out!  my caprese sub was delicious, in fact i was wishing i ordered the 12" after i devoured the 9" in about 2 minutes flat.  As everyone else mentioned the woman behind the counter could not be sweeter and the sandwiches are definitely worth the $1 more than Bari price tag.

The owner is, indeed, a lovely woman.  She is extraordinarily welcoming. The sandwiches, on the other hand, are good, but not great like others led me to believe.  At the moment, I think that Bari makes better sandwiches.

I finally gave Vinnie's a shot. It's definitely a lunch kind of place, which is unfortunate because I want to pick up a delicious sub on the way home from work. Oh well, it's amazing. I made it to the shop yesterday around 5:15, so it wasn't bad. I wish they'd stay open later, but that's alright. This is probably the best sub I've ever had!! I have not tried Bari yet, but I will give that a shot soon and compare.  I got the number 3. It had Prosciutto which tasted phenomenally, deliciously moist and fresh cut mozzarella, oils, basil (it really added so much flavor to the sandwich), tomatoes, lettuce, and I had her add some spicy peppers. The peppers were not spicy, they were pretty mild. I also ordered a small minestrone soup, but have not tried it yet. I got so full from the 12" sub!  The portions are huge, cheap, and the best I've ever had.  Also, the owner was the sweetest woman in the world. I spoke to her on the phone and she was extremely kind and helpful. She even knew who I was when I walked into the shop and treated me wonderfully. She also generously put a line through the tip line on the credit card receipt! I thought that was so sweet of her not wanting a tip. So nice. Love, love, love it and I am telling all of my Chicago friends.

We had planned to try Bari, but the set-up was too chaotic for us on a beautiful Saturday afternoon.  So we consulted Yelp on iPhone (so helpful!) and decided to check out Vinnie's. Such a great decision!  I had a caprese plus olives, and the boy had some fierce Italian conglomeration.  Both were super flavorful and generous in size (the smaller size was more than enough for me).  The caprese had lovely fresh mozzarella, tasty tomatoes, and just the right amount of basil. Even better than the taste?  The warm fuzzies I got from those working there.  They seemed to actually care whether we were comfortable.  Whether we liked the food.   The warmness of the staff made the food taste better, I think. Great food, great value, great service.  And it feels like it's not trying too hard.
huge sizes , fast , fresh meats,bread and cheese. The sweetest lady/owner always remembers you. I dont live near Vinnies anymore but still make the trip.
Haven't had a sandwich this good in years!  Reminds me of the stuff I ate all the time in New York.

Had a sandwich from here yesterday for the first time and am going back today. I love a good italian sub and this place seems to do it well. As others have said the owners are very friendly. Seems like a good place to support. It's right up there for me with Bari and Alpine. Edit: Went to Bari again today, first time since Vinnie's, and I realize this is going to be unbelievable to some of you out there, and I kinda don't want to admit it, but I think I like Vinnie's better. The crust on the bread at Bari is crisper, but to the point where it sometimes gives me that mouth feel like I used to have as a kid after I ate a bowl of coco puffs (ie. shredded). Anyway, both great places, you can't go wrong for a sandwich on this part of Grand Ave.

So less than a month later it's getting top shelf on yelp...i've been five times in less than a month.  I have. It's that good.   I have to say it's unquestionably one of the freshest, best prepared subs i've experienced in Chicago....and the soup matches the quality and taste of their subs.  I mentioned in a v recent Panera review that soups can be inherently heavy handed on the sodium front...not these, superb.  Chicken noodle, Tomato Bisque and Creme of Broccoli are simply amazing and pair perfectly with their Tuna Salad, Italian or Smoked Turkey w. pesto and buffalo mozz all on D'amato's french bread.  This place is another true diamond on a stretch of Grand w. many other diamonds imo (Salerno's, Oggi, Bella Notte, et al....)

This is a great little place to grab a sandwich when you're on the go! Although the line was out the door, it moves very fast, so don't let that throw you off. Quick in and out, and sometimes its so necessary.  Limited seating, a couple of tables inside and a few outside serve their purpose, but don't be surprised if they're all taken. I usually get the Caprese sandwich - fresh mozzarella, yum!

Vinnie's is right by my office, and I order it all the time.  However, I've never strayed away from the #1.  (9" Salami & Ham w/ Provolone on a fresh sesame roll - ordered once and was hooked).  I randomly checked out Yelp to see what people were saying about it, and the reviews are pretty consistent with my thoughts.  However, I've never tried the tuna that everyone seems to rave about.  I asked for a sample when I picked up my order today, and it was awesome. It was light an mayo and high on awesomeness.  For sure trying it next time.  Keep up the good work, Vinnie's.  I'm giving 4 Stars b/c its a sandwich shop, and 4 stars is as good as it should get for a $5 sandwich place. PS, not even going to compare/contrast to Bari.  They are two totally different sandwich shops, and yes, I love Bari too.

haha to brian t and john s...she calls me sweetie also...but hey thats what keeps me coming back..  Great sandwiches, fresh meats, and she reminds me of my mom..doesnt get any better than that...its not 5 stars only for the fact that i cant make up my mind whose sandwich is better between Vinnies and Bari which is down the block...  Check this spot out for lunch or on a saturday afternoon and you will see what all the craze is about..get the mortedella and capicolla (pronounced gabagool for all you non-italians) and you will leave satisfied.

I consider myself a sandwich expert, and Vinnies is the best sub in Chicago ! Their meats, veggies, and cheese are fresh. I don't know how they keep the bread in prime condition. It has a crispy crust and a chewy soft inside. The woman behind the counter couldn't be sweeter. I've tackled the foot long, and be warned it's not for beginners. The nine inch is plenty. Now that I've found Vinnies I will be a regular !

To John S.:  She calls you "Sweetie" too?  Man, she must use that line on everyone.  I bet she doesn't give you samples like she gives me. Yes, I get samples when I go to Vinnie's.  Their tuna salad is superb, and their business competes directly with Bari's.  I'll reduce your decision down to this:  Fifteen minutes of your time to save one dollar at Bari, or gain fifteen minutes time and enjoy better service and similar subs made with the same D'Amato bakery bread?

Great subs, and I go there all the time, but honestly, if it's a choice between Bari and VInnies, Bari is better. Get a prosciutto and mozarella at both places and compare them and the difference is obvious, Bari just uses better-quality ingredients. That said, it's a great place, and we go there more than Bari for some reason. The cashier is a very friendly fussy woman with a seemingly obsessive-compulsive method of taking your order and marking it on the order sheet and keeping track of all the orders. Funny that everyone mentions how nice the owners are, because they are, but when she gets flustered by a long line and her husband is around, they start to get a little uptight, which is actually kind of entertaining. Get the "#1" Vinnies special on the sesame roll. It's the only sandwich they have that's not on Bari's menu, and it's great.

I love Vinnie's Sub Shop!  I don't even like tuna but the lady gave me a sample of  the tuna salad  and I am hooked!  I am too afraid to try a tuna salad sub from any other place but I find myself craving one from Vinnies.  I would give this one more star to make it a perfect score however the only thing I have ordered here is the tuna sub because it is that good!   The service is second to none.  The lady who greets you has got to be one of the nicest strangers I've met in Chicago.

Love this place.  Bari foods has been down the block longer and seems to have a rep, but this place is every bit as good and has something Bari doesn't - awesome people. The owner is an absolute sweet heart and the food is great.  The pricing is similar to Bari and so is the product. Absolutely try it here.  Nicest owner on the planet and a great sub to boot. Skip the stupid line at Bari, let them dispense sour attitude to someone else, and give Vinnie's a try.  It's worth it.
Unreal.  Service is pretty good, but the real star is the food and the value.  The tuna salad sandwich is an addiction for me, add a slice of swiss cheese and welcome to Tiny Tuna heaven.

This place caught my eye on the day I moved in to my new apartment right down the street.  I work from home one or two days a week and could hardly wait to walk there for lunch.  I was not disappointed.  The sandwiches are amazing, inexpensive and huge.  The bread is amazing, tender and crusty.  I've tried to order something different each time, or at least make additions to my favorites such as marinated eggplant.   Also, I must mention how incredibly nice and friendly the owners are, I feel like family every time I'm there.

I HIGHLY recommend the Tuna sub, they must put drugs in it because i crave it at the wierdest times. like when i wake up. It is really the best Tuna sub i have ever had. friendly people working there also.
This place is great!  Great subs, low price, nice staff.  I would recommend this place to anyone in the area.  Great local establishment.

"What can I getcha sweetie?" That sums up this place perfectly. Vinnie's is a great neighborhood sandwich shop that never forgot it's a neghborhood sandwich shop. The woman who takes your order talks to you as if you've been coming there for years. The sandwiches are large and very cheap. The bread has always been fresh and the variety of sandwich options is great. I have never been disappointed and am a little afraid if more people find out, it'll get crowded. Forget what I said. You never heard of Vinnie's. Vinnie's is my place I tell ya!

My wife and I absolutely love this place.  While its neighbor, the Bari Market, garners all the attention, this place is as good, and yet, remains off the radar for the most part. I cannot speak to all of their sandwiches because I always get the large Vinnie's Special [comes on french, instead of the sesame].  However, the portions are just right and the taste is phenomenal. Where Vinnies is a step above: the service.   You will always be greeted with a smile and a kind word.  The people who run the shop are genuinely nice and will do whatever they can to make sure your experience is pleasant. There is not much inside seating to speak of, so ordering to go may be your best bet during the winter months.  In the summer, they have a small patio out front with 3-4 tables. Even though we've moved out of the neighborhood, we will continue to frequent Vinnies.  In this day and age, its a rarity to find a place with good service, good food, and good prices.

i had intended to go to this place for about 2 years now. i finally stopped in after a hard day's work in my studio. i was greeted by the sweetest woman who called her customers "sweetie" or "hon" or something (and managed to NOT sound obnoxious in the process - she was endearing!)  i ordered the fresh mozzarella, tomato and basil sandwich, to eat there. it's just a tiny store front, but there is a table in the window with about four chairs. the bread was scrumptious, the mozzarella was dead fresh and the basil yum yum! they have coke products on fountain (thumbs up) and several other drink options. highly recommended for anyone in need of a quick, delicious bite. quick note about their hours: they aren't posted. it seems they stay open as long as the bread lasts - my guess is you'll want to get there before 5 pm. oh, and subs come in 9" and 12" - didn't see any 6" on the menu...
Was turned onto this place by someone from work. All around good subs. A great price for the size too, 6" for $4! They also have a couple vegetarian subs.

Solid sub shop.  I really love hitting this joint for lunch and do so all the time.  The subs are great and very reasonably priced.  The staff is great and the whole experience reinforces the great neighborhood vibe going on.  I like the tuna sub - not super oniony.
I highly recomend going there!!   never been dissapointed  great subs..
In an area with great sub shops this one is my favorite.  Great value, friendly staff.

I am so happy to have discovered Vinnie's! Since I moved to Chicago 4 years ago I've been desperately searching for a good sub. Vinnie's is the place. . . big sandwiches with plenty of meat and cheese (no skimpy Subway portions here) on yummy crusty bread. . . and cheap! A 6" turkey and cheese is under $4! And the staff is so nice! I was there yesterday and the man and woman (the owners?) who were there were real chatty, but in an honestly friendly way, like they really wanted to know how my day was. and the 12" sub I got for f$6 or so fed me for 2 days. Can't beat that!
i've looked for a long time to find a good sub shop and this one is definitely high on my list.  they are cheap and a good size
A great little sub shop on Grand ave!  Cheap and good!
